utterance.content: Huh?! Yeah. She also said if she slept with you before she liked you, then it would have been easier to handle when you turned into the sorry bastard that left her alone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I told her you were wasting her time, by the way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think that’s going to stop her? The woman’s the worst realtor in New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How do you feel?

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Weak, sleeping all the time.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That’s normal after radiation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Deep breath.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: A little queasy, too. When I feel sick to my stomach I always want vanilla ice cream, it’s soothing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s best to stick with liquids for now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shhh. I’m getting a murmur.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Oh, oh my arm! It’s hurting me! Take it off! Take it off!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Pain isn’t the issue. Just the pressure of the BP cuff was enough to start her screaming.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s not cancer. It sounds like…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It sounds like she’s septic.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A lot of things can cause pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How much?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Too much.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s not cancer, it’s not autoimmune. It’s an infection and we fried her immune system.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But she had no fever. Her LP was clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do an echo to confirm it’s in her heart, and then I’ll tell our patient that we just killed her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’ll tell her.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Oh, great. You haven’t been returning my phone calls.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m busy.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Well, um, but if you have half an hour this afternoon, I just found this unit, it hasn’t been on the market yet –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m off the market for condos.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: James was right. I never had the teeniest chance of selling you anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course he was right. He doesn’t stop giving good advice just because you’re divorced. He’s compulsive about remaining on good terms with his exes.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Do you want to know why I named that dog Hector?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Let’s keep it a mystery.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Because even when he was a puppy, he was the worst-tempered dog we’d ever seen he. He was supposed to be house-trained, but he’d pee on the carpet every morning. When we had people over, he would nip at their ankles. “Hector does go rug” is an anagram for “Doctor Greg House” – that’s how early in the marriage I resented you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Did I ever waste money on that place setting.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: James at least had the decency to feel guilty when he hurt me!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whereas I never hurt you! I never even married you, cleverly hoping to avoid moments like this one.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: You always needed him, and he was always there for you!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You keep yelling, and I’ll think you owe me sex.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: You knew he had a wife waiting at home, you didn’t care. I’m not saying you broke up the marriage, but you didn’t help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First, “Hector does go rug” is a lame anagram. You want a better one for “Gregory House”: “Huge ego, sorry”. Second, find a new career. You’re never going to sell to anybody if you let them control the agenda. And third, I don’t owe you anything. I’m not Wilson, I’m not going to buy a condo just to make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Tell me how to do this. House says people thank you after –

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It’s not typical.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I already killed this woman. All I can do now is not make any more mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: First of all, stop thinking you can minimize the hurt. A lot of people are afraid of the word ‘dying’ – if you pussyfoot around it, she’s not going to read your mind.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, it’s not. When you look in her face, you’re going to feel the instinct to temporize. Crush it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then wait. Give her time to process the news. Let her know you’ll be with her through all of it. Wait ‘till she’s done thinking, until you think it’s appropriate, then maybe you can touch her, put your hand on her arm like this, let her know that she’s still connected to another human being.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’ve got this down to a science.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re freaking out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I told you –

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Give her what she needs. What she doesn’t need is a doctor who’s not there with her because he made the wrong call. You are freaking out. You should be freaking out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I won’t let her see it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Let her see it.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Hey. How come no mask?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We think… we think you have an infection.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Didn’t the radiation work?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It did what it was supposed to do. You’re dying.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: What, what do you mean, like some day things are bad, and I’m gonna… How much time? How much time?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can’t know exactly.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: A year? Less than a year?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Less than 24 hours.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Why are you sayin’ this to me, you tryin’ to scare me? Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It’s true.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: How bad is this cancer? Yesterday you thought I had a chance.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don’t have cancer. You came in with an infection. We didn’t catch it.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: What kind of infection?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. The radiation was the worst thing we could have done. We destroyed the part of your body that was fighting it off. It spread to your heart –

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Then give me drugs! They have drugs for infections.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Antibiotics work with the immune system, but your immune system is non-existent because of the radiation.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: If it’s my heart, you can get me a new heart. People have heart transplants all the time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It wouldn’t help. The infection’s everywhere. There’s nothing we can do. I’m so sorry. We’ve called your grandparents.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Get the hell away from me! Get out! Get out!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I think it’s broken.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing like a melodramatic gesture to solve everything.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We were wrong, too. Steroids wouldn’t have helped her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I didn’t help her, I pulled the trigger.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There’s nothing left for you to do. One of us could go home with you –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Are you trying to make me feel better?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I killed a woman, don’t you think it’s appropriate I feel like crap for at least a little while?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It won’t help you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He went to the ICU.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prepping for an aspiration. We still don’t know what infection –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s not going to help her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not going to hurt her. Well, it is going to hurt her, but –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This will just take a few minutes. Grab a piece of an abscess, some pus –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You really don’t care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You really don’t care why she’s going to be dead.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She’s going to be dead –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: WHAT? What did we screw up, what did we miss? I need to know.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’ll have to wait. We’re moving her back to her room.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Patients who’ve had total body radiation have to stay in ICU.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ICU isn’t gonna help her. Let’s give her some privacy.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: What do you want? Wanna see if I’m dying on schedule? Or do you want me to tell you it’s all right, I’m okay with it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’d like your forgiveness, but I don’t expect it.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Good, ‘cause this isn’t like you ran your cart into mine at the supermarket.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. Your grandparents haven’t arrived yet. If they don’t make it on time, is there anything you’d like me to tell them?

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Never really knew them.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You got any friends you’d like me to call?

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: It’s the middle of the night. They’re not the kind of friends you call to ask you move, let alone watch you die. I never did much. No kid to leave behind. When I leave, the world’s not gonna be any different. Kind of a relief for you, huh?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were right about me.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Yeah, which time?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I, uh, I had a problem with you. But you were wrong, too. I’ve made some bad decisions. Stole cars, robbed houses.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Killed a woman.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But then I got another chance. Left home, went to college, entered a whole ‘nother world. And yet some part of me I can’t get rid of thinks, “If I’m not the smartest, if I’m not the first, everywhere I go, they’ll figure out I’m not supposed to be here.” They’ll send me back.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: You know that’s not going to happen. You’re out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’ll never be out of there. When I came home, that last Christmas I was in college, it was like… the rooms felt so small. It was so suffocating. But when I was standing on the stoop saying goodbye, my mom put her arms around me. That was the last time I ever felt at home. I only put distance between you and me because I know there isn’t any.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: You were right about me, too. That stuff about the system being against people like me, I know it’s crap. I mean, it’s true, but it’s also crap. I just wasn’t ready to try again. But I always thought I was young, I had time.

utterance.speaker: Lupe
utterance.content: Aren’t you ever gonna leave?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Time of death, 3:35. Do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want to go get drunk?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No thanks. I’ve got paperwork.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Listen, I don’t… I don’t know what I believe, but sometimes I need to think there’s something out there paying attention. So when I can’t talk to anybody, I talk to God, and pretend somebody’s listening. We were all wrong, Foreman. Even House was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I got your consent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her bra hook.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She scratched herself with her bra hook. That’s how the infection got in. Staph aureus.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She died from a simple Staph infection?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That and some bad decisions.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’ll be outside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go home, have a few drinks, go to sleep, get up tomorrow, and do it tomorrow, only better. If you need absolution, go to a priest or give alms to the poor, whatever ritual comforts you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I killed her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This wasn’t, “oh, I should have thought of that idea sooner”. This wasn’t messing up a dosage. We see a disease rushing down on someone like a train, we can’t always get them out of the way. But this wasn’t that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. And you’ll do it again. To a lot of doctors, this would be a once-in-a-lifetime kind of mistake. But we’re not a lot of doctors. We’ll save a lot more patients than the guy down the street, but a few of the ones he’d save by doing what everyone else does we will lose.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So you’re giving me numbers?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because they don’t lie. I can’t forgive you, Foreman, because there’s nothing to forgive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What’d you tell him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That guilt is irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You wanna get something to eat?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can’t. I’ve got a dog waiting at home.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I did something bad, Mom. I hurt somebody.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It was.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Do you know who I am, Mom? It’s Eric.
